identificationModule.briefTitle: Free Fatty Acids-Induced Hypertension in Obese Subjects (Aim #2)
identificationModule.officialTitle: Free Fatty Acids-Induced Hypertension, Endothelial Dysfunction, Inflammation, Insulin Resistance, and Autonomic Dysfunction in Lean and Obese Subjects (Aim #2)

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to see if salsalate, an Nuclear factor-kappaB (NF-κB) mediated inflammation inhibitor, or carvedilol, an α- and β-blocker, will protect against free fatty acid induced hypertension, insulin resistance, endothelial dysfunction, inflammation and oxidative stress, and autonomic dysfunction in obese normotensive subjects.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: During postprandial lipemia, dietary triglycerides transported by intestinal chylomicrons are hydrolyzed by lipoprotein lipase lining the vascular bed, with subsequent release of FFA for transport across the endothelium. Whether the intermittent flux of FFA has the same impact as the i.v. lipid infusion will be examined. Decreased endothelial function has been reported after a single or long-term dietary high fat load in normal subjects; however, others have found no effects on brachial artery vasoreactivity. Our preliminary studies indicate that high oral fat loads (60 g) resulted in higher FFA levels and BP changes, and reduced FMD compared to low fat load (25 g).

armGroups.label: Salsalate
armGroups.description: Obese, normotensive, healthy subjects will receive an intravenous (IV) administration of Intralipid 20% for 24 hours, and then one salsalate 750 mg tablet twice daily for two weeks. If the subject has no side effects, the dose will be increased to two salsalate 750 mg tablets twice daily for the remaining four weeks. The subjects will then receive another 24-hour IV administration of Intralipid 20% at the 6-week point.

armGroups.label: Carvedilol
armGroups.description: Obese, normotensive, healthy subjects will receive an intravenous (IV) administration of Intralipid 20% for 24 hours, and then one carvedilol 3.125 mg tablet twice daily for two weeks. If the subject has no side effects, the dose will be increased to two carvedilol 3.125 mg tablets twice daily for the remaining four weeks. The subjects will then receive another 24-hour IV administration of Intralipid 20% at the 6-week point.

armGroups.label: Placebo
armGroups.description: Obese, normotensive, healthy subjects will receive an intravenous (IV) administration of Intralipid 20% for 24 hours, and then one placebo tablet twice daily for two weeks. The dose will be increased to two placebo tablets twice daily for the remaining four weeks. The subjects will then receive another 24-hour IV administration of Intralipid 20% at the 6-week point.

interventions.name: Intralipid 20%
interventions.description: 24-hour infusion of Intralipid 20% solution at 20 mL/h (96 g/24 h)

primaryOutcomes.description: Systolic blood pressure is the amount of pressure the heart generates when pumping blood through the arteries to the body. Current guidelines identify normal systolic blood pressure as lower than 120 mmHg. Blood pressure was measured in triplicate with a manual cuff prior to and every 4 hours during the 24-hour infusion with subjects in supine position. Change is the difference in systolic blood pressure at the baseline visit from pre-dosing with Intralipid to 4 hours during Intralipid infusion.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Pre-dose (Baseline), within 4 hours at Baseline visit

primaryOutcomes.description: The change in endothelium-dependent vascular reactivity will be measured by flow-mediated dilation (FMD) of the brachial artery using a high-resolution vascular ultrasound with a 10-MHz linear array transducer. FMD is expressed as the percentage increase in diameter at the baseline visit from pre-dosing with Intralipid to 12 hours during Intralipid infusion.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Pre-dose (Baseline), within 12 hours at Baseline visit

primaryOutcomes.description: The change in endothelium-dependent vascular reactivity will be measured by flow-mediated dilation (FMD) of the brachial artery using a high-resolution vascular ultrasound with a 10-MHz linear array transducer. FMD is expressed as the percentage increase in diameter at the baseline visit from pre-dosing with Intralipid to 24 hours during Intralipid infusion
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Pre-dose (Baseline), within 24 hours at Baseline visit

primaryOutcomes.description: The change in endothelium-dependent vascular reactivity will be measured by flow-mediated dilation (FMD) of the brachial artery using a high-resolution vascular ultrasound with a 10-MHz linear array transducer. primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Pre-dose (Week 6), within 24 hours at Week 6 visit

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Diastolic Blood Pressure From Baseline to 6 Weeks
secondaryOutcomes.description: Diastolic blood pressure is the amount of pressure in the arteries when the heart is at rest between beats. Current guidelines identify normal diastolic blood pressure as lower than 80 mmHg. Blood pressure was measured in triplicate with a manual cuff prior to and every 4 hours during the 8 hour infusion with subjects in supine position. Change is the difference between 6-week diastolic blood pressure from baseline diastolic blood pressure.

Oxidative stress was measured by using liquid chromatography to collect plasma glutathione and glutathione disulfide. Change is the difference between 6-week plasma glutathione and glutathione disulfide from baseline plasma glutathione and glutathione disulfide.

AIx is a surrogate measure of peripheral arterial resistance and is measured by analysis of the pulse wave at the radial artery. The AIx is calculated as the ratio of the pulse pressure at the second systolic peak to that at the first systolic peak. Change is the difference between 6-week AIx from baseline AIx.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Expression of Inflammatory Biomarker Interleukin-6 (IL-6)
secondaryOutcomes.description: It is measured by using microsphere-based flow cytometric immunoassay. Change is the difference between 6-week level from baseline level.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in FFA (Free Fatty Acid) Levels From Baseline to 6 Weeks
secondaryOutcomes.description: Blood samples were collected for measurement of free fatty acids at baseline and 6 weeks after the Intralipid 20% infusion. FFA levels were determined by colorimetric method. Current guidelines identify normal range of FFA level as less than 0.72 mmol/L. Elevated plasma levels of FFA indicate a greater rate of insulin resistance. Change is the difference between 6-week FFA levels from baseline FFA levels.

PWV was measured between the carotid and femoral arteries using the SphygmoCor device. Pressure waveforms at the carotid and femoral arteries were acquired using EKG gating. Velocity (distance per time in milliseconds) was calculated using the foot-to-foot method and the distance between the sites was measured manually.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Expression of Inflammatory Biomarker C-Reactive Protein (CRP)
secondaryOutcomes.description: It is measured by using microsphere-based flow cytometric immunoassay. Change is the difference between 6-week inflammatory biomarker level from baseline level.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Males or females
* Obese subjects (body mass index (BMI) ≥ 30 kg/m\^2)
* 18 and 65 years
* Blood pressure reading \< 140/80 mm Hg and no prior history of hypertension

Exclusion Criteria:

* History of diabetes mellitus
* History of hypertension
* Fasting triglyceride levels \> 250 mg/dL
* Liver disease (ALT 2.5x \> upper limit of normal)
* Serum creatinine ≥1.5 mg/dL
* Smokers, drug or alcohol abuse
* Mental condition rendering the subject unable to understand the scope and possible consequences of the study
* Female subjects who are pregnant or breast feeding

participantFlowModule.preAssignmentDetails: All subjects will receive IV Intralipid (20% solution at 20 ml/hour) prior to randomization.
participantFlowModule.recruitmentDetails: Subjects recruited from July 2009 to January 2011 at Grady Memorial Hospital.

groups.title: Salsalate
groups.description: Obese, normotensive, healthy subjects received an intravenous (IV) administration of Intralipid 20% for 24 hours, and then one salsalate 750 mg tablet twice daily for two weeks. If the subject had no side effects, the dose was increased to two salsalate 750 mg tablets twice daily for the remaining four weeks. The subjects also received another 24-hour IV administration of Intralipid 20% at the 6-week point.

groups.title: Carvedilol
groups.description: Obese, normotensive, healthy subjects received an intravenous (IV) administration of Intralipid 20% for 24 hours, and then one carvedilol 3.125 mg tablet twice daily for two weeks. If the subject had no side effects, the dose was increased to two carvedilol 3.125 mg tablets twice daily for the remaining four weeks. The subjects also received another 24-hour IV administration of Intralipid 20% at the 6-week point.

groups.title: Placebo
groups.description: Obese, normotensive, healthy subjects received an intravenous (IV) administration of Intralipid 20% for 24 hours, and then one placebo tablet twice daily for two weeks. The dose was increased to two placebo tablets twice daily for the remaining four weeks. The subjects also receive another 24-hour IV administration of Intralipid 20% at the 6-week point.

baselineCharacteristicsModule.populationDescription: All but one of the subjects that completed the study were included in the baseline analysis. No data was recorded for one subject who withdrew from the study.

The subjects also received another 24-hour IV administration of Intralipid 20% at the 6-week point.

groups.title: Placebo
groups.description: Obese, normotensive, healthy subjects received an intravenous (IV) administration of Intralipid 20% for 24 hours, and then one placebo tablet twice daily for two weeks. The dose was increased to two placebo tablets twice daily for the remaining four weeks. The subjects also receive another 24-hour IV administration of Intralipid 20% at the 6-week point.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Systolic Blood Pressure
outcomeMeasures.description: Systolic blood pressure is the amount of pressure the heart generates when pumping blood through the arteries to the body. Current guidelines identify normal systolic blood pressure as lower than 120 mmHg. Blood pressure was measured in triplicate with a manual cuff prior to and every 4 hours during the 24-hour infusion with subjects in supine position. Change is the difference in systolic blood pressure at Week 6 from pre-dosing with Intralipid to 12 hours during Intralipid infusion.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: 7 subjects withdrew from the study prior to the Week 6 visit. Data was also not collected for one additional subject.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Pre-dose (Week 6), within 12 hours at Week 6 visit

The subjects also received another 24-hour IV administration of Intralipid 20% at the 6-week point.

The dose was increased to two placebo tablets twice daily for the remaining four weeks. The subjects also receive another 24-hour IV administration of Intralipid 20% at the 6-week point.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Flow-mediated Dilation
outcomeMeasures.description: The change in endothelium-dependent vascular reactivity will be measured by flow-mediated dilation (FMD) of the brachial artery using a high-resolution vascular ultrasound with a 10-MHz linear array transducer. FMD is expressed as the percentage increase in diameter at the baseline visit from pre-dosing with Intralipid to 12 hours during Intralipid infusion.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: One subject in the salsalate arm withdrew from the study was not included in the baseline analysis population.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Pre-dose (Baseline), within 12 hours at Baseline visit

The dose was increased to two placebo tablets twice daily for the remaining four weeks. The subjects also receive another 24-hour IV administration of Intralipid 20% at the 6-week point.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Diastolic Blood Pressure From Baseline to 6 Weeks
outcomeMeasures.description: Diastolic blood pressure is the amount of pressure in the arteries when the heart is at rest between beats. Current guidelines identify normal diastolic blood pressure as lower than 80 mmHg. Blood pressure was measured in triplicate with a manual cuff prior to and every 4 hours during the 8 hour infusion with subjects in supine position. Change is the difference between 6-week diastolic blood pressure from baseline diastolic blood pressure.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: 6 subjects were lost to follow up, 1 withdrew from the study, and data was not collected for 1 additional subject
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Baseline, 6 weeks

groups.title: Salsalate
groups.description:
Obese, normotensive, healthy subjects will receive an intravenous (IV) administration of Intralipid 20% for 24 hours, and then one salsalate 750 mg tablet twice daily for two weeks. If the subject has no side effects, the dose will be increased to two salsalate 750 mg tablets twice daily for the remaining four weeks. The subjects will then receive another 24-hour IV administration of Intralipid 20% at the 6-week point.

Salsalate: Salsalate 750 mg

Intralipid 20%: 24-hour infusion of Intralipid 20% solution at 20 mL/h (96 g/24 h)

groups.title: Carvedilol
groups.description:
Obese, normotensive, healthy subjects will receive an intravenous (IV) administration of Intralipid 20% for 24 hours, and then one carvedilol 3.125 mg tablet twice daily for two weeks. If the subject has no side effects, the dose will be increased to two carvedilol 3.125 mg tablets twice daily for the remaining four weeks. The subjects will then receive another 24-hour IV administration of Intralipid 20% at the 6-week point.

Carvedilol: Carvedilol 3.125 mg

Intralipid 20%: 24-hour infusion of Intralipid 20% solution at 20 mL/h (96 g/24 h)

groups.title: Placebo
groups.description:
Obese, normotensive, healthy subjects will receive an intravenous (IV) administration of Intralipid 20% for 24 hours, and then one placebo tablet twice daily for two weeks. The dose will be increased to two placebo tablets twice daily for the remaining four weeks. The subjects will then receive another 24-hour IV administration of Intralipid 20% at the 6-week point.

Placebo: One tablet

Intralipid 20%: 24-hour infusion of Intralipid 20% solution at 20 mL/h (96 g/24 h)

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Oxidative Stress Markers.
outcomeMeasures.description: Oxidative stress was measured by using liquid chromatography to collect plasma glutathione and glutathione disulfide. Change is the difference between 6-week plasma glutathione and glutathione disulfide from baseline plasma glutathione and glutathione disulfide.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: not assessed (limited funds available)
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Baseline, 6 weeks

groups.title: Salsalate
groups.description: Obese, normotensive, healthy subjects received an intravenous (IV) administration of Intralipid 20% for 24 hours, and then one salsalate 750 mg tablet twice daily for two weeks. The dose was increased to two placebo tablets twice daily for the remaining four weeks. The subjects also receive another 24-hour IV administration of Intralipid 20% at the 6-week point.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Augmentation Index (AIx)
outcomeMeasures.description: AIx is a surrogate measure of peripheral arterial resistance and is measured by analysis of the pulse wave at the radial artery. The AIx is calculated as the ratio of the pulse pressure at the second systolic peak to that at the first systolic peak. Change is the difference between 6-week AIx from baseline AIx.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: not assessed (limited funds available)
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Baseline, 6 weeks

groups.description: Obese, normotensive, healthy subjects received an intravenous (IV) administration of Intralipid 20% for 24 hours, and then one salsalate 750 mg tablet twice daily for two weeks. The dose was increased to two placebo tablets twice daily for the remaining four weeks. The subjects also receive another 24-hour IV administration of Intralipid 20% at the 6-week point.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Expression of Inflammatory Biomarker Interleukin-6 (IL-6)
outcomeMeasures.description: It is measured by using microsphere-based flow cytometric immunoassay. Change is the difference between 6-week level from baseline level.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Baseline, 6 weeks

groups.title: Salsalate
groups.description: Obese, normotensive, healthy subjects received an intravenous (IV) administration of Intralipid 20% for 24 hours, and then one salsalate 750 mg tablet twice daily for two weeks. If the subject had no side effects, the dose was increased to two salsalate 750 mg tablets twice daily for the remaining four weeks. groups.description: Obese, normotensive, healthy subjects received an intravenous (IV) administration of Intralipid 20% for 24 hours, and then one carvedilol 3.125 mg tablet twice daily for two weeks. The dose was increased to two placebo tablets twice daily for the remaining four weeks. The subjects also receive another 24-hour IV administration of Intralipid 20% at the 6-week point.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in FFA (Free Fatty Acid) Levels From Baseline to 6 Weeks
outcomeMeasures.description: Blood samples were collected for measurement of free fatty acids at baseline and 6 weeks after the Intralipid 20% infusion. FFA levels were determined by colorimetric method. Current guidelines identify normal range of FFA level as less than 0.72 mmol/L. Elevated plasma levels of FFA indicate a greater rate of insulin resistance. Change is the difference between 6-week FFA levels from baseline FFA levels.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Baseline, 6 weeks

groups.title: Salsalate
groups.description: Obese, normotensive, healthy subjects received an intravenous (IV) administration of Intralipid 20% for 24 hours, and then one salsalate 750 mg tablet twice daily for two weeks. If the subject had no side effects, the dose was increased to two salsalate 750 mg tablets twice daily for the remaining four weeks. The subjects also received another 24-hour IV administration of Intralipid 20% at the 6-week point.

groups.title: Carvedilol
groups.description: Obese, normotensive, healthy subjects received an intravenous (IV) administration of Intralipid 20% for 24 hours, and then one carvedilol 3.125 mg tablet twice daily for two weeks. groups.description: Obese, normotensive, healthy subjects received an intravenous (IV) administration of Intralipid 20% for 24 hours, and then one placebo tablet twice daily for two weeks. The dose was increased to two placebo tablets twice daily for the remaining four weeks. The subjects also receive another 24-hour IV administration of Intralipid 20% at the 6-week point.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Pulse Wave Velocity (PWV)
outcomeMeasures.description: PWV was measured between the carotid and femoral arteries using the SphygmoCor device. Pressure waveforms at the carotid and femoral arteries were acquired using EKG gating. Velocity (distance per time in milliseconds) was calculated using the foot-to-foot method and the distance between the sites was measured manually.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: not assessed (limited funds available)
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Baseline, 6 weeks
